description: SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION, EXTENSION OF  ROOF ABOVE GARAGE, REAR DORMER EXTENSION, ALTERATIONS TO OPENINGS AND INSTALLATION OF ROOF LIGHTS
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - By reason of the scale, bulk, design, materials and form, the proposals would result in an inappropriate form of development that would be unduly prominent, visually dominant and intrusive and unsympathetic to the character and appearance of the host dwelling, the subject building's pair, and the wider area. Therefore, the proposals are contrary to policy CS14 of the Core Planning Strategy 2011 and Policies DM D2 and DM D3 of the Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Reason : 2 - The proposed rear extension, by reason of its scale, siting and design, would be overly dominant and an un-neighbourly form of development resulting in, an overbearing impact to adjacent occupants and cause a sense of enclosure. The proposal would therefore be contrary to policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policy CS 14 of the Merton Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and DM D3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 

"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
